South Africa's parliament squeezed in the debate on the State of the Nation address as well as the president's reply before the budget speech is set to be delivered. Here we verify key claims made by members of parliament as they reflected on newly-elected President Cyril Ramphosa's maiden address.The Democratic Alliance’s (DA) George Michalakis pointed out that while the Western Cape province has high levels of violence, it has the lowest unemployment rate in the country.
“The Western Cape has the lowest unemployment rate of all provinces”
“In the unemployment figure of the Western Cape, the bulk of that is youth unemployment”
“Black students obtaining a university degree are more than double the number of white students at the moment.”
“Local government receives an average of 9% from the national fiscus”
“Last year, we increased the number of tourists by 12.8%”
“We boast the highest unemployment rate in the world”
“30 million South Africans have to make ends meet with less [than] R1,000 a month.”
“27% of children under the age of 5 are stunted, nearly 30% of boys and 25% of girls.”
“The biggest cause of death among women is non-communicable diseases.”
“South Africa has the third highest incidence of TB in the world after India and China.”
"We are the most obese country... amongst the world.”
“The reality is that the real matric pass rate is at 37.3%.”
“A black child is… 100 times more likely to grow up in poverty than a white child.”
“[Of those] fortunate enough to get to matric and pass and enter university, half will drop out before they reach their second year.”
“Over 8.8 million South Africans were the target of online cybercrime in 2016.”
“[South Africa] is in debt of more than R2.3 trillion.”

“The debt that is guaranteed by the state in Eskom is R350 billion. In SANRAL, it’s R38.9 billion. In South African Airways, it’s R19.1 billion. In Denel, it’s R1.8 billion. In the Road Accident Fund, it’s R8.5 billion.”
